qas.question: The Empire had a Christian majority until what time?

answers.text: the second half of the 15th century

qas.question: What group ruled the empire until the 15th century?
What group began to decline within the Empire in the late 19th century?
Muslims accounted for what amount of the population of the Empire in the 1820s?
In 1914 what portion of the Empire weren't Muslims?

context: Until <a0_0>the second half of the 15th century<a0_0/> the empire had a Christian majority, under the rule of <a1_0>a Muslim minority<a1_0/>. In the late 19th century, <a2_0>the non-Muslim population<a2_0/> of the empire began to fall considerably, not only due to secession, but also because of migratory movements. The proportion of Muslims amounted to <a3_0>60%<a3_0/> in the 1820s, gradually increasing to 69% in the 1870s and then to 76% in the 1890s. By 1914, only <a4_0>19.1%<a4_0/> of the empire's population was non-Muslim, mostly made up of Christian Greeks, Assyrians, Armenians, and Jews.
